nodes.name: StringIndexer
nodes.description: StringIndexer encodes a string column of labels to a column of label indices

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: handleInvalid
fields.title: Handle Invalid
fields.description: Invalid entries to be skipped or thrown error

nodes.name: VectorAssembler
nodes.description: Merges multiple columns into a vector column

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: inputCols
fields.title: Input Columns
fields.description: Input column of type - all numeric, boolean and vector

nodes.name: Split
nodes.description: This node splits the incoming DataFrame into 2. It takes in the fraction to use in splitting the data. For example, if the fraction is .7, it would split the data into 2 DataFrames, one containing 70% of the rows and the other containing the remaining 30%.

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: fraction1
fields.title: Fraction 1
fields.description: Fraction to be used for Splitting the DataFrame into two. The first DataFrame would go to the lower edge output. The other would go to the higher edge output.

nodes.name: RandomForestClassifier
nodes.description: Supports both binary and multiclass labels, as well as both continuous and categorical features.
nodes.details:
Random forests supports both binary and multiclass labels, as well as both continuous and categorical features.

More at Spark MLlib/ML docs page : spark.apache.org/docs/latest/ml-classification-regression.html#random-forest-classifier

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: featuresCol
fields.title: Features Column
fields.description: Features column of type vectorUDT for model fitting

fields.name: labelCol
fields.title: Label Column
fields.description: The label column for model fitting

fields.name: predictionCol
fields.title: Prediction Column
fields.description: The prediction column created during model scoring.

fields.name: featureSubsetStrategy
fields.title: Feature Subset Strategy
fields.description: The number of features to consider for splits at each tree node.

fields.name: impurity
fields.title: Impurity
fields.description: The Criterion used for information gain calculation

fields.name: maxBins
fields.title: Max Bins
fields.description: The maximum number of bins used for discretizing continuous features.Must be >= 2 and >= number of categories in any categorical feature.

fields.name: maxDepth
fields.title: Max Depth
fields.description: The Maximum depth of a tree

fields.name: minInfoGain
fields.title: Min Information Gain
fields.description: The Minimum information gain for a split to be considered at a tree node

fields.name: minInstancesPerNode
fields.title: Min Instances Per Node
fields.description: The Minimum number of instances each child must have after split
